lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Ah, a traveler! I feared no one would answer my summons. Please, come closer.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: The tremors grow worse by the day. Something stirs beneath our Watchtower—something ancient and terrible.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: We need someone capable to investigate. The guards are spread thin, and the miners refuse to descend. Will you help us?

responses.text: Tell me more about these tremors.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Thank you, brave soul. Speak with me again once you've seen what lurks below. May the old harmonies protect you.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: The corruption is called the Echo. It was sealed away long ago by the Resonance Keepers—an order of mages who sacrificed everything to protect our world.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: The town's treasury is modest, but we will reward you fairly. More importantly, if the corruption spreads, there will be no safe haven left. Your survival depends on this as much as ours.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Their seal—the Aegis—protected us for centuries. But now it weakens. What you've felt are not mere earthquakes. Reality itself trembles.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: You've seen it, haven't you? The crystalline growths, the unnatural light... This is worse than I feared.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Those creatures—Echo Mites, we call them—are merely the vanguard. They must be driven back before more emerge.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Return to the basement and eliminate three of the Echo Mites. We need time to prepare our defenses.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Be careful down there. The Echo twists everything it touches. Return to me when the mites are dealt with.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Fragments of the Echo Primordial's will given physical form. Each one is a tiny piece of something vast and hungry. They are not truly alive—merely extensions of a greater consciousness.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: You've driven back the mites. Well done—but I fear this is only the beginning.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: The crystalline corruption they leave behind may hold answers. Gather five Echo Shards and bring them to me. Our blacksmith can analyze their properties.

responses.text: Is it safe to touch them?

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Good. Return to the basement and gather what you can. Handle them carefully.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Brief contact should be safe, but I wouldn't recommend prolonged exposure. The Echo has a way of... influencing those who draw too close. Bring them directly to Blacksmith Brond.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Elara tells me the mana leaks are contained. Your help has been invaluable, champion.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: But the tremors continue. The corruption's source lies deep beneath the Watchtower—in the old passages the miners call the Undermines.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Find the entrance to the subterranean levels. It should be hidden somewhere in the Watchtower's lower reaches.

responses.text: What should I expect down there?

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: The ancient passages are dangerous, but I believe in you. Return when you've found the way down.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: The Undermines predate our town by millennia. The Resonance Keepers built their facility around them, studying whatever lay below. Be prepared for anything.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: By the old harmonies... you've recovered the Shard of Resonance! I never thought I would see such an artifact in my lifetime.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: This shard is one of fourteen fragments of the original Aegis. The Resonance Keepers scattered them as a failsafe, should the seal ever weaken.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: I must tell you the truth now. The Aegis was never meant to be permanent. We must forge a new barrier—and you may be the one to do it.

responses.text: Why didn't you tell me this before?

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Speak with me again. We must activate the ancient obelisk at the town's center.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Would you have believed me? Would anyone? The secret has been kept for generations, passed from elder to elder. You have proven yourself worthy of the truth.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: The obelisk at our town's center is no mere monument. It is a Resonance Anchor—a focal point for the Aegis's power.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Take the Shard of Resonance to the obelisk and place it in the receptacle at its base. This will strengthen the local seal.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Be ready for anything. The obelisk has not been activated in centuries. We cannot know exactly what will happen.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: The constructs are defeated, but the obelisk's activation has revealed something troubling.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: The Aegis network extends far beyond Hearthwell. To properly calibrate our anchor, we need readings from across the wilderness.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Travel the lands surrounding our town. The obelisk will automatically gather data as you explore.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Return when you have covered sufficient ground. The wilderness holds many dangers—be cautious.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Champion... I can sense the change in you. Your attunement to the resonance frequencies is complete.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: You have done what I never thought possible. The first shard is secured, and Hearthwell is protected—for now.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: But the corruption spreads beyond our borders. Reports speak of strange lights in the Thornveil Forest to the east. More shards await.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: You have become something more than a mere adventurer. You are a Harmonizer—perhaps the first in centuries. The world needs you.

responses.text: I'm ready for what comes next.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Then prepare yourself. The hunt for the remaining shards begins. May the old harmonies guide your path!

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: One who can perceive and manipulate resonance frequencies—the fundamental vibrations that underlie all reality. The Resonance Keepers were all Harmonizers. Now, it seems, you have joined their legacy.

lines.speaker: Elder Malik
lines.text: Greetings, traveler. These are dark times for Hearthwell. Stay vigilant.

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: *examines the shards closely* Fascinating... These aren't ordinary crystals. They vibrate at frequencies I've never encountered.

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: If you leave them with me, I can analyze their properties. It may take some time—these harmonics are unlike anything in my forge.

responses.text: Here are the shards. What should I do in the meantime?
What can you tell me about their origin?

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: Stay close. When these crystals are heated, they may attract... attention. Report to Elder Malik; he'll have further instructions.

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: These resonate at frequencies similar to the ancient obelisk in the town center. Whatever force created them is tied to the deepest foundations of our world.

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: I've completed my analysis. These shards are definitely connected to the Echo corruption—but there's more.

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: When properly tuned, they can be used to detect other sources of the same energy. This could help us find the corruption's heart.

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: I need to perform one more test—a resonance sounding. It will draw Echo creatures, so I'll need you to defend the shop.

responses.text: I'll protect you during the test.

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: Good. Stay close and be ready. This will take about a minute, but it will feel much longer.

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: *studies the Echo Crystals with wonder* These are far more potent than the shards. Pure crystallized corruption.

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: Combined with my earlier research, I can now forge tools that will help you confront what waits below.

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: The miners spoke of a massive creature guarding the deepest breach. An Echo Beholder. You'll need to defeat it to reach the source.

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: A being of concentrated Echo energy—a guardian placed by... something. It protects what lies beyond. But it also guards a prize: the first Aegis shard. Speak with Elder Malik when you're ready to descend.

lines.speaker: Blacksmith Brond
lines.text: Need something forged? Or perhaps repaired? My forge burns hot, even in these troubled times.

lines.speaker: Captain Kael
lines.text: So you're the one Elder Malik keeps talking about. I've been watching your progress.

lines.speaker: Captain Kael
lines.text: You've shown skill against the Echo creatures, but skill alone isn't enough. You need to understand what we're truly fighting.

lines.speaker: Captain Kael
lines.text: I want you to prove your combat readiness. Complete a trial of my design, and I'll share what I know of the corruption's military implications.

lines.speaker: Captain Kael
lines.text: Good. Show me what you're made of. Return when you've proven yourself.

lines.speaker: Captain Kael
lines.text: A warrior's trial. You'll face combat scenarios designed to test your reaction, endurance, and adaptability. Nothing you haven't already done—just more... focused.

lines.speaker: Captain Kael
lines.text: Stay alert, citizen. These are dangerous times. The guard is stretched thin as it is.

lines.speaker: Mage Elara
lines.text: *adjusts her crystal-tipped staff* You must be the champion everyone is talking about. I could use your help.

lines.speaker: Mage Elara
lines.text: The town's protective wards are failing. The resonance instability is disrupting the mana flows, creating leak points that attract Echo creatures.

lines.speaker: Mage Elara
lines.text: I've located three major mana fluxes that need stabilization. Each one is guarded by Echo manifestations.

lines.speaker: Mage Elara
lines.text: Defeat the creatures guarding each flux node, and the wards will recalibrate automatically. My preparations will handle the rest.

lines.speaker: Mage Elara
lines.text: Simply clear the area around each flux point. Remove the Echo interference, and the natural mana flow will restore itself. The wards are self-repairing—they just need a clear path.

lines.speaker: Mage Elara
lines.text: The resonance frequencies are disturbed. I sense great upheaval beneath the surface. Tread carefully.

lines.speaker: Merchant Lysa
lines.text: Looking to buy or sell? My wares are the finest in Hearthwell—though supplies are... limited these days.

lines.speaker: Guard Thorne
lines.text: Keep your weapon ready, adventurer. The creatures from below grow bolder by the day.
